trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class provides a hierarchical menu Web server control.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to markup and added to the existing markup for the Web page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class provides design-time support for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> controls in a visual designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the templates of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class methods provide the following functionality:
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method gets the markup that renders a placeholder for the associated control at design time when no markup is otherwise available.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method provides the markup that renders the associated control at design time when an error has occurred.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control to the design-time data source.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetSampleDataSource%2A> method constructs a sample data source that can be used at design time for the associated control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property creates a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class, adds it to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> that is obtained from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.ActionLists%2A> base property, and then returns the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection>.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Gets the collection of predefined formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> object is populated from predefined internal constants.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> that contains the predefined schemes for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the provider can refresh the schema.
`true` if the schema can be refreshed; otherwise, `false`.
Binds the associated control to the design-time data source.

If one of the following conditions is true, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.DataBind%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.Items%2A> property, and then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> base method:
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> property is not `null` or an empty string ("").
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property is not `null`.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.Items%2A> collection contains one or more elements.
The `dataBoundControl` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of that control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> to bind to the design-time data source.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.DataBind%2A> method to bind the design-time data source to the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control, and then the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.GetDesignModeState%2A> method to cause the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control to generate its static-view and dynamic-view markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> returns the markup for the current view.

If the current view is not defined, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> base method.
A string containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> at design time.
Gets the markup that renders a placeholder for the associated control at design time when no markup is otherwise available.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method generates the markup for a placeholder that specifies the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control name and a message instructing you to use the collection editor to add items.
A string containing markup text that renders to a placeholder on the design surface.
Provides the markup that renders the associated control at design time when an error has occurred.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method generates markup that renders the error design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control as a placeholder that contains the type name, the control name, and messages describing the error.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> object that was thrown.
A string that contains the markup used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> at design time after an error has occurred.
Constructs a sample data source to use at design time for the associated control.
The sample data source that is constructed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetSampleDataSource%2A> method has several root menu items with empty paths.
This sample data source is used at design time if no menu items are defined for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control and if the menu cannot be bound to a data source.
An object implementing the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalEnumerable"></xref> to use as a data source for the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref>.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

The visual designer calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.Initialize%2A> method and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of that control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref>, which implements the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> interface.
*component* is not a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> or of a class derived from <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref>.
Refreshes the schema of the data source view for the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.RefreshSchema%2A> method will be called by the design host only if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.CanRefreshSchema%2A> property is true.
If `true`, does not display error messages when exceptions occur during processing; otherwise, exception messages are displayed.
Gets a schema that describes the data source view for the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema"></xref> object that describes the structure of the data source.
Gets a collection of template groups for the templates of the associated control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property gets a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> base property.

It then adds to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> object named "`ItemTemplates`" that contains two <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> objects named "StaticItemTemplate" and "DynamicItemTemplate".
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> to the caller.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection"></xref> containing an element for each template in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a copy of the associated control or use the control itself to generate the design-time markup.

Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> object.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer uses the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> object itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control are persisted to the page markup source.
Always `true`.
Gets a value indicating whether the provider can refresh the schema.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider.CanRefreshSchema"></xref> property.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider> interface.
`true`, if the schema can be refreshed; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider.RefreshSchema(System.Boolean)"></xref> method.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider> interface.
`true` to indicate that error messages should not be displayed when exceptions occur during processing; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the current schema object for the designer.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider.Schema"></xref> property.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider> interface.
The current schema object for the designer.
